meanings.sent1: Before the trip, she was prelocating the best spots to visit.
meanings.sent2: The hikers were prelocating the campsite for safety reasons.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he was prelocating the remote control to avoid losing it.
meanings.sent4: The detective's keen eye for detail helped him prelocate the missing item.
meanings.sent5: By prelocating the emergency exits, the event organizers ensured everyone's safety.

meanings.sent1: Prelocating is essential for efficient planning.
meanings.sent2: The prelocating of resources saved time during the project.
meanings.sent3: Her talent for prelocating made her a valuable asset to the team.
meanings.sent4: The success of the mission relied on the prelocating of key targets.
meanings.sent5: The prelocating of the treasure map added excitement to the adventure.

meanings.definition: Positioned or situated before something else
meanings.sent1: The prelocating sign indicated the upcoming turn.
meanings.sent2: She admired the prelocating flowers leading the way.
meanings.sent3: The prelocating chairs were reserved for special guests.
meanings.sent4: The prelocating marker guided them along the trail.
meanings.sent5: The prelocating stars shone brightly in the night sky.
